main_definition: In English, the word 'babies' primarily refers to very young human children who are in their infancy or early childhood.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Infants or newborns, typically considered as young children from birth up to one year old
meanings_and_examples.example: The nurse took care of the babies at the hospital.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A colloquial term sometimes used informally to refer to any group of people or things that are seen as vulnerable, inexperienced, or needing protection
meanings_and_examples.example: The security team was assigned to guard the babies at the event.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A term used metaphorically to describe something new, untested, or immature that needs guidance and nurturing
meanings_and_examples.example: The company has a 'baby' product in development that will require careful planning before it reaches the market.
